Crimes.Crime_Name: Importing cocaine contrary to Controlled Drugs and Substances Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Interpretation of 'punished' in s. 64(2) of IRPA; Charter s. 7 challenge
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Controlled Drugs and Substances Act
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Appeal dismissed for lack of jurisdiction
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish grounds for appeal
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 64(2) IRPA excludes appeal rights if punished by at least two years’ imprisonment
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Jurisdiction of Appeal Division under IRPA
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Constitutionality of s. 64(2) IRPA under Charter s. 7
Crimes.Review_Standard: Standard of review on questions of law: reasonableness
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach of procedural fairness found
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA, Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Interpretation and constitutionality of s. 64(2) IRPA
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No direct response; Crown defended IRPA provision
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Leave to appeal and declaration that s. 64(2) violates Charter
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Serious criminality under IRPA due to conviction with sentence of >2 years
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Immigration appeal and judicial review process
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: No error in law or constitutional violation found
